front.question: The hypoxic drive is influenced by:
Which of the following organs or tissues can survive the longest without oxygen?
A patient who is suspected of being hypoxic and is breathing adequately should be given supplemental oxygen with a:
Which of the following is a late sign of hypoxia?
The pressure of gas in a full cylinder of oxygen is approximately _______ pounds per square inch (psi).
The diaphragm is innervated by the _________ nerve, which allows it to contract.
front.source: See Anatomy of the Respiratory System

front.question: Irregular respirations characterized by an increasing rate and depth of breathing followed by periods of apnea are called:

choices: decreased levels of oxygen in the blood result in free radical production.
significantly low levels of oxygen in the blood damage the cellular tissue.
cellular tissue damage occurs from excessive oxygen levels in the blood.
excessive blood oxygen levels cause the hypoxic patient to stop breathing.
front.question: Oxygen toxicity is a condition in which:

cards.back: cellular tissue damage occurs from excessive oxygen levels in the blood.

front.question: Structures of the lower airway include all of the following, EXCEPT:
front.source: See Anatomy of the Respiratory System

choices: water or blood within the alveoli.
front.question: Gas exchange in the lungs is facilitated by:
At a flow rate of 6 L/min, a nasal cannula can deliver an approximate oxygen concentration of up to:
Which of the following structures is NOT found in the upper airway?
front.source: See Anatomy of the Respiratory System

front.question: Which of the following factors will cause a reduction in minute volume in an adult?
Which of the following oxygen flowmeters is NOT affected by gravity and can be used in any position when attached to an oxygen cylinder?
What is the MOST common cause of airway obstruction in an unconscious patient?
High-flow oxygen with a nasal cannula during the preoxygenation phase of endotracheal intubation is called:
front.source: See Assisting With ALS Airway Procedures

front.question: With a good mask-to-face seal and an oxygen flow rate of 15 L/min, the nonrebreathing mask is capable of delivering up to ______% inspired oxygen.
The presence of elevated carbon dioxide levels in the blood is called:

choices: An unconscious 52-year-old female with snoring respirations and cool, pale skin
A conscious male with respirations of 18 breaths/min and reduced tidal volume
A conscious male with respirations of 19 breaths/min and pink skin
A conscious female with facial cyanosis and rapid, shallow respirations
front.question: Which of the following patients is breathing adequately?

cards.back: A conscious male with respirations of 19 breaths/min and pink skin

front.question: An oxygen cylinder should be taken out of service and refilled when the pressure inside it is less than:
